III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation While Youth A was placed at the facility, someone tried to go into
the Youth A’s room and sexually assaulted the youth. No details
are known.
Investigation Complainant was contacted via telephone on 10/31/2024.
Complainant said Youth A did not provide specific details nor
identify who assaulted him during his placement at the facility.
DHHS Worker 1 was contacted via telephone 10/31/2024. DHHS
Worker 1 reported Youth A is currently placed with Grandmother.
He said DHHS Worker 2 attempted to forensically interview Youth
A, but he refused to answer any questions and had threaten
DHHS Worker 2. He said DHHS Worker 3 will be going out today
to attempt a 2nd interview with Youth A at Grandmother’s home.
DHHS Worker 3 was contacted via telephone on 10/31/2024.
DHHS Worker 3 reported a second attempt will be made to
interview Youth A on 11/01/2024. DHHS Worker 3 agreed to have
DCWL participate via telephone during the interview if Youth A
does participate in the interview.
DHHS Worker 3 was contacted via telephone on 11/01/2024.
DHHS Worker 3 reported Youth A refused to be interviewed and
therefore Youth A was not interviewed.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 11/01/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Administrator reported Youth
A was placed at the facility on 09/18/2024 thru 10/18/2024, and
that during his placement at the facility Youth A primarily stayed in
his room. Youth A had refused to participate in group therapy,
school, and refused to shower. He said the only incident reports
involving Youth A were for Youth A refusing to shower.
Administrator recalled expressing his concerns regarding Youth A
2

refusing to come out of his room with Youth A’s JJ Worker.
Administrator said Youth A never attempted to self-harm, but he
just refused to come out of his room or interact with the other
youths. He recalls staff did encourage him and attempted to get
Youth A to come out of his room. Administrator said all the
youths’ papers are filed accordingly, are kept locked in the
supervisor office, and staff and supervisors do not discuss the
youths’ charges with other youths. He denied other youths being
aware of Youth A’s criminal charges. He said youths with similar
charges have the same counselor, so youths can figure out what
similar charges other youths are facing. Administrator denied any
incident reports involving Youth A being assaulted or hurt during
his placement at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 11/01/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Staff 1 has been working at
the facility for 35 years and is a group leader. Staff 1 was familiar
with Youth A and recalled that Youth A spent a lot of time in his
bedroom, refused to shower, and would not participate in group
therapy. He denied being aware of any incidents where Youth A
was assaulted by staff or other youths. Staff 1 said he and staff
attempted to encourage Youth A to come out of his bedroom, but
Youth A refused. Staff 1 said Youth A would get upset with staff
for telling him to come out of his room. Staff 1 said he had good
rapport with Youth A and feels Youth A would have told him if
something happened to him during his placement at the facility.
He said staff always supervise youths when they are in the rooms
and would do not allow youths to go into other youths’ bedrooms.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 11/01/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Staff 2 has worked at the
facility for 25 years and works first shift. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was at the facility for approximately one month and recalls Youth
A did not engage with other youths. He said Youth A would refuse
to come out of his bedroom and was very withdrawn. Staff 2
denied witnessing Youth A being assaulted or hurt during his
placement at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 11/01/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B has been at the
facility for four months. Youth B denied having any interactions
with Youth A but recalls Youth A stayed in his room a lot. Youth B
denied witnessing or hearing of any incidents involving Youth A
being assaulted by staff or other residents. Youth B reported
feeling safe at the facility and all his needs are being met.
3

Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 11/01/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C has been at the
facility for 5 months. Youth C reported staff at the facility only
come into the youths’ rooms to clean them and youths have to
step outside of the room when staff come into their bedrooms.
Youth C said residents are not allowed to go into other residents’
rooms. Youth C recalls Youth A stayed in his bedroom the
majority of the time he was at the facility. Youth C denied
witnessing anyone at the facility assaulting Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 11/01/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth D has been at the
facility for two months. Youth D denied having any interactions
with Youth A but does remember hearing Youth A cuss at Staff.
Staff tried to get Youth A to come out of his room, but Youth A
would yell and cuss at staff. He said Youth A’s room smelled
because Youth A would not shower or clean his bedroom. Youth
D said he knew about Youth A being charged for touching a youth
at a previous placement because Youth A’s probation paper was
attached to his file. Youth D said he never told anyone about
Youth A’s paperwork being attached to his own paperwork. Youth
D reported feeling safe at the facility and expressed no concerns
regarding the staff.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 11/13/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Supervisor 1 reported he
administrated the medication to Youth A in the morning and in the
evening. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A did not engage with other
youths and refused to come out of his bedroom. Supervisor said
there was one incident were Youth A verbally threatened him,
when he was doing a random check on Youth A. Supervisor
reported the incident and completed an incident report. He recalls
Youth A sometimes would make remarks about something is
wrong with his brain and that he needs to have brain surgery.
Supervisor 1 denied any incident where Youth A was assaulted in
his bedroom or any issues with other youths. Supervisor denied
being aware that the other youths were aware of Youth A’s
charges or had access to Youth A’s probation papers. He said
youths are provided their court report to review before their court
hearing.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on 11/13/2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Supervisor 2 denied any
incident involving Youth A being assaulted at the facility.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was only at the facility for one
month and Youth A stayed in his bedroom the majority of the time.
4

He recalls Youth A refused to come out of his bedroom, refused to
shower, or participate in group therapy. Supervisor 2 said they
had to clean Youth A’s bedroom several times during his
placement, and there were never any issues with Youth A.
Supervisor 2 denied being aware of other youths knowing about
Youth A’s criminal charges. He said all youths’ files are filed
separately in the officer and locked in the filing cabinet.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed via telephone on 11/26/2024.
Supervisor 3 reported all youths files are filed in the supervisor
office and double locked. He said the youths are provided with
their court paperwork before the court hearing to review and the
report is returned to the file after the hearing. He denied any
incident where youths court paper had been accidently given to
other youths. He said youths usually figure out what charges other
youths are facing based on the counselor that is assigned to them.
Supervisor 3 denied any incidents involving Youth A being
assaulted or hurt during his placement at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 09/19/2024, Youth A refused to come
out of his bedroom for showers.
• Incident report dated 09/25/2024, Youth A refused to come
out of his bedroom for showers.
• Incident report dated 10/02/2024, Supervisor 1 was doing
random checks on Youth A and Youth A became visibly
and verbally upset and threatened Supervisor 1.
• No grievances filed by Youth A.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance per interviews with Staff and
Youths there is no evidence of Youth A was sexually assaulted
while placed at the facility. Two attempts were made to interview
Youth A, and he refused to be interviewed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
